resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
tianchen92 commented on pull request #5625: ARROW-6853: [Java] Support vector and dictionary encoder use different hasher for calculating hashCode
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5625
 
 
   Related to [ARROW-6853](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6853).
   
   Hasher interface was introduce in ARROW-5898 and now have two different implementations (MurmurHasher and SimpleHasher) and it could be more in the future.
   
   And currently ValueVector#hashCode and DictionaryHashTable only use SimpleHasher for calculating hashCode. This issue enables them to use different hasher or even user-defined hasher for their own use cases.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.description:
Hasher interface was introduce in ARROW-5898 and now have two different implementations ({{MurmurHasher and SimpleHasher}}) and it could be more in the future.

And currently {{ValueVector#hashCode}} and {{DictionaryHashTable}} only use {{SimpleHasher}} for calculating hashCode. This issue enables them to use different hasher or even user-defined hasher for their own use cases.
fields.summary: [Java] Support vector and dictionary encoder use different hasher for calculating hashCode
